content.prompt: The variety of t’oqapu designs covering the All-T’oqapu tunic indicates to scholars that

choices.label: the garment was pieced together from many smaller pieces.
the garment was a royal tunic that symbolized the power of the Sapa Inka.
the garment was an offering to Inti, the Inka sun god and chief deity.
the garment was created during the colonial period and traded to the Spanish.

topic.text: 5.4: Theories and Interpretations of Indigenous American Art

skill.text: Skill 7.B: Explain how one or more art historically valid interpretations of a work of art (or group of related works of art) are derived from an analysis of its form, style, materials, content, function, context, reception, and/or meaning.
